Package org.example.ui

Interface UserIO

All Known Implementing Classes:
UserIOCommandLine
public interface UserIO
A generic interface used to ensure correct user interface functionality when used with the DVDController class.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    DVD
    add()
    Creates a DVD object based on input from the user, to be added to the collection.
    void
    display(String dvdString)
    Display information on a single DVD, using the provided information.
    String[]
    edit(String[] DVDData)
    Given an array containing information for a DVD, returns an edited version of that information.
    int
    editOptions()
    Provide options to the user based on editing a DVD within the array, and return an integer reflecting the choice.
    int
    greet()
    Run on startup, provide the user with a list of options, and return an integer pertaining to the option chosen.
    void
    list(String[] collection)
    Provide the user with information on all DVDs in the collection, as provided in String format
    void
    remove(String DVDName)
    Informs the user that a DVD has been deleted corresponding to the DVDName parameter provided.
    int
    reOption()
    Provides similar functionality to greet, but is run after an operation has been completed, rather than on startup.
    void
    savingError()
    Report that there has been an error while saving the document, and all changes made during this session will not be committed.
    String
    searchRequest()
    Queries the user for a search term that can be used to search for a particular DVD via the DVD's title.
    void
    stop()
    Ends all user interface elements, and says goodbye to the user.

  • Method Details

    • greet

      int greet()
      Run on startup, provide the user with a list of options, and return an integer pertaining to the option chosen.
      Returns:
      1 = Add item, 2 = Search database, 3 = List all entries, -1 = quit.

    • reOption

      int reOption()
      Provides similar functionality to greet, but is run after an operation has been completed, rather than on startup. Must still provide the user with a list of options and return an integer.
      Returns:
      1 = Add item, 2 = Search database, 3 = List all entries, -1 = quit.

    • add

      DVD add()
      Creates a DVD object based on input from the user, to be added to the collection.
      Returns:
      A new DVD object based on input.

    • remove

      void remove(String DVDName)
      Informs the user that a DVD has been deleted corresponding to the DVDName parameter provided. This method does not need to gather or provide any information, as the DVD has already been deleted.
      Parameters:
      DVDName - The name of the DVD that has been removed.

    • list

      void list(String[] collection)
      Provide the user with information on all DVDs in the collection, as provided in String format
      Parameters:
      collection - String array where each element corresponds to a single DVD in the collection

    • display

      void display(String dvdString)
      Display information on a single DVD, using the provided information.
      Parameters:
      dvdString - The information pertaining to the DVD, provided as a verbose string.

    • searchRequest

      String searchRequest()
      Queries the user for a search term that can be used to search for a particular DVD via the DVD's title.
      Returns:
      The search term provided by the user.

    • editOptions

      int editOptions()
      Provide options to the user based on editing a DVD within the array, and return an integer reflecting the choice.
      Returns:
      1 = edit item, 2 = remove item, -1 = return to root menu.

    • edit

      String[] edit(String[] DVDData)
      Given an array containing information for a DVD, returns an edited version of that information. Should retrieve any changes from the user, and implement them to the return string array.
      Parameters:
      DVDData - The supplied data as it exists from the collection.
      Returns:
      The edited data with the user's changes applied.

    • savingError

      void savingError()
      Report that there has been an error while saving the document, and all changes made during this session will not be committed.

    • stop

      void stop()
      Ends all user interface elements, and says goodbye to the user.
